instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Hi
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A have boot loop with internal KB and TP. But it boots normally without KB and TP. External KB and mouse works fine. I also checked with new Topcase with new KB and TP but still same issue.

There is no liquid damage on the board, looks very neat and clean. I have also checked the J4501 and J4500 diode mode reading couldn't find any clue. compared these diode mode reading with known good working machine which was normal.

please suggest me where to start and what i am missing.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message: Disconnect KB, keep only TP connected; check if still goes into boot loop.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message: yes i tried both one by one, still was doing same boot look.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Try to discard a software issue.
Recover data and do new macOS installation.

BTW, did PRAM reset?

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Did the new MacOS install and PRAM reset as well several times.

No boot loop with Keyboard connected and TP not connected.
but there is no activity on keyboard.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
KB will not work without TP!

Check <CHIP>U4520</CHIP>/40 and <TRANSISTOR>Q4530</TRANSISTOR> areas.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
didn't find any issue in that area.
i am getting following values 

<TRANSISTOR>Q4530</TRANSISTOR>. pin 3- <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CS_L_CONN</SIGNAL>- 3.28V

<CHIP>U4540</CHIP> Pin 4- <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_INT_L</SIGNAL>- 3.32V

<CHIP>U4520</CHIP> Pin 4 - <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_CONN</SIGNAL>- 3.32V

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_INT_L</SIGNAL> voltage on working board.
Remember to keep TP connected, when diagnose this problem.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Connected TP only. No KB.
<CHIP>U4540</CHIP> Pin 4- <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_INT_L</SIGNAL>- 3.32V

<CHIP>U4520</CHIP> Pin 4 - <SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_CONN</SIGNAL>- 3.32V

these signal stays at these value. i didn't find any change.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
While only TPAD connected 
these are the values i get
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_INT_L</SIGNAL>- 3.32V
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_IF_CONN</SIGNAL>- 3.32V
<SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_3SDA</SIGNAL>-3.32V
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CS_L_CONN</SIGNAL>-5.1v
<SIGNAL>PP5V4_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL>-5.1V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PME_S4_WAKE_L</SIGNAL>-3.2V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ACTUATOR_DISABLE_L</SIGNAL>-3.2V
<SIGNAL>KBD_INT_L</SIGNAL>-3.3V
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_MOSI</SIGNAL>-0V
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CLK_CONN</SIGNAL>-0V
<SIGNAL>KBD_I2C_SCL</SIGNAL>-0V
<SIGNAL>KBD_BLC_GSSIN</SIGNAL>-3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL>-3.3V
<SIGNAL>TPAD_SPI_CLK</SIGNAL>-0V

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
Your problem seems to be caused by CPU itself.
Without TP/KB machine works, as CPU is clocked to minimum.

Just in case, try clean ME BIOS...

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
can i please get the fress bios for this machine?
i tried to download from other sources that is having size problem keep saying does not match the chip size.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message:
No Luck 
tried both but same behaviour.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message: do i Give Up or try something else?

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message: Check if works under WIndows, or Linux at least.

threads.title: MacbookPro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Boot loop with internal KeyBoard and TP
threads.message: Tried installing  Window 10 but no luck same response. Booting properly without TPAD. But when connects TPAD, shut downs in few seconds and reboot.
